description: The app, which can be installed on Android and IOS phones or accessed through USSD for users without smartphones, was developed by biochemist Donatus Njoroge, IT expert Gideon Kamau, and medical doctor Jesse Gitaki.

title: Kenyan university launches contact tracing app
description: Victoria Ngumi, vice chancellor of Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology (JKUAT), said that the application known as contact tracing and case management web and mobile application is meant to help identify who, where and when someone gets into contact with a COVID-19 patient.

title: Itoju: Nigeria Coronavirus app
description: A company representative told The Correspondent: “The app provides vital information to sensitize the general public about Covid19 and how best to protect themselves following the WHO guidelines. The app also serves as a reporting tool for citizens to ask for help or report any suspicious activities related to coronavirus for active community tracking. We noticed that the emergency response call line would be overwhelmed during this period, so we incorporated a chat system and distributed call setup to help optimize and complement the existing system by the NCDC. The app also features an active map with geolocation showing the spread of Covid19 in Nigeria both at the National and state level. However, to give people more access to the platform, we discontinued the mobile application and moved some of the features to a web platform in April 2020 - reportcorona.ng

title: Boda Community: Ghana contact tracing website
description: Triage questions and contact tracing
organizations: Cansantey Business Systems Group, Channel IT GHANA

title: Brazilian Hospital Albert Einstein launches self-assessment website
description: The Israelite Albert Einstein Hospital has launched the site autoavaliacaocoronavirus.einstein.br, which allows the public to answer a questionnaire and conduct a self-assessment online

title: "Coronavirusecuador.com" website
description: The website has the same function as the app, allowing users to directly call health authorities if they have COVID-19 symptoms and also has an option to schedule medical appointments on the website. The website also features a chatbot to answer questions.

title: Alerta Honduras information and self-assessment app
SMS Covid19: Mexico City's SMS chatbot
description: By texting the word "covid19" to 51515, people in Mexico City can answers questions and find out what they should do in case they have symptoms. "If it is If necessary", the authorities will contact them "to receive due attention".

title: Coronavirus UY: Uruguay's symptom checker and contact tracing app
method: App, Google Apple Exposure Notification (GAEN), Smartphone, Symptom checker
description: Starting out as a self-assessment app, now CoronavirusUY also lets users activate “Exposure Alerts” to allow contact tracing, using the Google and Apple system
organizations: The Agency for Electronic Government and the Information and Knowledge Society (Agesic) and the Ministry of Public Health of Uruguay (MSP)

title: Mexico City tracks quarantined patients via telecoms data
description: On March 31, 2020, the Government of Mexico City announced that "Telephone companies will provide access to cell phone antennas so that, through the Digital Agency for Public Innovation (ADIP), monitoring of the movement and contact between people in Mexico City, with the aim of identifying if people are complying with the isolation ".

title: Simmov: App for authorities in Argentinian province of Jujuy
description: App designed so authorities can scan IDs in order to facilitate contact tracing, to track lockdown compliance and gauge citizens movements
enforcement_details: The scan of one document (circulation permit) is mandatory, others are voluntary. The use of the app was temporarily halted by a judicial decision, but was resumed in July.

title: Cordoba's "Vecino Salud" app
description: Symptom checker and information app

title: Anglo American proposes contact tracing system for its SA mines
description: The company says it’s "too early to be specific" about how its system will work

title: Epione: South Africa symptom checker
description: South Africa's epione.net is piloting a symptom tracker, which allows users to request a screening if they meet case definition guidelines.

title: Debo: Ethiopia contact tracing app
description: And an app called Debo captures the identity of anyone who comes within two meters of the user so that contacts can be traced should the person one day test positive.
organizations: Ethiopian Public Health Institute, Ministry of Health

title: COVID 19 Ethiopia: symptom checker app
description: The COVID-19 Ethiopia app was launched in late May so that the public can self-report cases or alert health authorities to others with symptoms.
organizations: Ethiopian Public Health Institute, Ministry of Health

title: Start-up introduces COVID-19 status verification software
description: Employees at Truework, an income verification start-up, will be asked to share their COVID-19 health data with their HR team. The employees will be required to submit information such as recent lab test results, and Truework may then verify that information with the lab itself.

title: PwC contact tracing
description: PwC, the professional services firm, is using technology that it originally developed to track inventory for a new contact-tracing system that logs employee interactions so workers can be notified in the event of exposure to the coronavirus.

title: KastleSafeSpaces system for offices
method: App, Fever detection, Smartphone, Thermal imaging
description: Businesses that use the company’s coronavirus management system, KastleSafeSpaces, may ask employees to download an app that will automatically open entrance doors for people eligible to come to the office. Workers who fill out a health screening questionnaire ahead of time may proceed to a lobby fast lane to have their temperatures checked. Those who have been asked to stay home because they recently tested positive for coronavirus may go on a kind of no-fly list and find that doors will automatically stay closed for them.

title: Clear's corporate "health pass"
purpose: Travel authorization, Social control (workers/students), Proof of immunity
description: Clear, the biometric identification company known for its air-traveler identification service, recently introduced a system called Health Pass for office buildings, restaurants, retailers, cruise ships and sports arenas. It will use facial recognition to confirm employees’ identities and vet worker-provided health information — such as symptom data and verified test results — so they can be cleared to enter workplaces.

title: Microshare's wearable contact tracing system
description: Microshare, a software company in Philadelphia that uses sensors to monitor environmental factors — like indoor air quality and occupancy — for offices and manufacturing plants, is marketing a different kind of contact-tracing system. It is adapting Bluetooth technology that it originally developed to track the locations of wheelchairs and beds in hospitals for tracking employees. Employees will wear wristbands or carry credit card-size badges that collect signals about their whereabouts and proximity to one another; that data is sent to devices that transmit it to the cloud. Microshare said employers could also use its system to identify spots where infected workers may have recently gathered, enabling companies to shut down specific areas, rather than an entire building, for deep cleaning.

title: Verily health screening and analytics platform
description: The service, announced on Thursday, will offer Covid-19 diagnostic testing for employees and clear them to return to the workplace based on their test results and other health data. It will also make recommendations to employers on how often workers should be retested, based on the prevalence of the virus in their work force and the local community.

title: ProtectWell: Microsoft and UnitedHealth Group's symptom checking app
description: When staff at New York’s Natural History Museum were asked to enter their symptoms in the app, their Union filed an unfair labor practice complaint.

title: Ready To Work: Fitbit symptom checker
description: Fitbit introduced a program that includes a daily symptom-checking app for employees and a work force health-monitoring dashboard for employers.

title: Kogniz AI workplace camera system
description: Kogniz, an artificial intelligence start-up, is marketing thermal camera systems as coronavirus fever-screening and "social-distancing enforcement" tools for the workplace.

title: AI start-up Jvion creates employer recovery package
description: Jvion, another A.I. start-up, is marketing an "employer recovery package" to predict the risk of employee exposure to the virus and likelihood of developing it.

title: PopID health screening at Subway restaurant
method: Facial recognition, Fever detection, Thermal imaging
description: Owner of a Subway branch store in LA implemented temp. screening system. When workers stepped inside the employee food prep area, a fever-detection and facial recognition camera service, PopID, quickly identified him by name and gauged his temperature. Then a small tablet screen underneath the camera posted a message that cleared him to enter.

title: NBA "smart ring" health tracker
description: One optional tool the NBA is using for players within the bubble is the Oura smart ring, a wearable device that can measure skin temperature and heart rate, among other metrics. Oura is a lightweight metallic ring clad in sensors that enable the ring to measure metrics like your heart rate, skin temperature, and respiratory rate as well as your activity. It generates a risk score.

title: Pegasystems app to track employees' Covid-19 exposure
description: Employees self-report their COVID-19 status via a short set of risk assessment questions. Their answers feed into the status dashboards and trigger a series of automated actions that guide affected employees, their managers, and human resources with instructions on how to manage their situation.

title: Cordata's Back-to-Work COVID Tracking System
description: The system includes "Assessment and tracking of individuals’ COVID-19 status, protocols and safety measures, including on-location contact-tracing".

title: Arcoro Includes COVID-19 Self-Screening Mobile Health Form in its Time Clock App
description:
The form asks employees two simple "yes or no" questions: first, whether they are experiencing symptoms such as fever, cough or shortness of breath; and second, whether they have been in contact with someone diagnosed with COVID-19 or have been told to self-isolate by a doctor or medical official.  

If the worker answers "yes" to either question, they are advised to leave the worksite and seek medical attention.

title: Appian's Covid-19 response system
description: The system includes "screening" as well as "investigatory contact tracing".

title: Estimote's "Proof of Health" wearable lanyards, wristwatches, or cards.
description: The wearable conducts GPS location tracking and Bluetooth contact tracing, and collected information is centrally stored and displayed on a health dashboard that "provides detailed logs of possible contacts.

title: Apple Watch adds function to track hand-washing
description: The new hand-washing monitor tells users how long they should wash their hands.

title: Chile's Covid-19 contagion maps
description: Chile's Ministry of Health (known as Minsal) keeps a georeferenced database, which is permanently updated, but which very few can access. Maps leaked to newspaper, reavealing location of Covid patients.

title: Chile's telecom companies confirm mobile mobility monitoring
description: Telecommunications companies operating in Chile confirmed that they are providing "aggregated and anonymous data on key mobility for public policies in the current pandemic.

title: Temperature screening in Chilean region
method: CCTV, Facial recognition, Fever detection, Thermal imaging
description: The mayor of Las Condes, Joaquin Lavín, said in a video, he plans to install cameras that take people's body temperatures in crowded places such as subway exits or bus stop.

title: Chilean region to use drones to enforce lockdown
description: The mayor of Las Condes, Joaquin Lavín, said drones would be used to tell people gathering in public places to return home

title: Tierra del Fuego's app: "TDFUnida
method: App, Permit app, Smartphone, Symptom checker
description: The government of the province of Tierra del Fuego launched the "TDFUnida" app in late April. The province established that people can only go out twice a week, for a maximum time of three hours each time, for example to go to the supermarket or the pharmacy. The TDFUnida app has a built-in self-diagnosis function to obtain the authorization to leave and travel. After its launch, criticisms of the application for its various security flaws and development errors were posted on Twitter.

title: Covid19 Jujuy
description: Symptom checker issued by Jujuy Province

title: Kansas uses Unacast data for anonymized phone tracking
description: Kansas is the first state to publicly acknowledge its use of such a program. Dr. Lee Norman, the head of the [health and environment] department, said that the state was using a platform called Unacast, which compares anonymized GPS data from before and after the implementation of social-distancing measures to track the measures’ effectiveness and offer county-level grades. Uses location data from other apps on a person's phone.
organizations: The Kansas Department of Health and Environment, Unacast

title: India’s Nivida "Unlock 2020" system for workplaces
purpose: Social control (workers/students), Contact tracing, Medical diagnostics
description: Merges employee attendance tracking with temperature log. A company representative told Vice the next step is to incorporate Bluetooth for contact tracing.

title: South Korea’s Epidemic Investigation Support System
method: Big data, Financial data, Telecom data
description: A contact tracing platform that enables health officials to access location data and credit card transactions without a court order.

title: South Korea's tracking wristbands for people found to violate their quarantine terms
description: The Korean government announced plans to roll out location-tracking bracelets for people who break quarantine after reports of people tricking the government-mandated app by leaving their smartphones at home. The wristbands would instantly alert authorities if people tamper with them or cut them off. After backlash from human rights organizations, the government said the use of bracelets requires consent.

title: Self-Quarantine Safety Protection: South Korean quarantine app
description: All arrivals must download a government app that tracks their location and requires users to report any symptoms… After the two-week period, the app shows a message saying users are free to delete it from their phones.

title: Alibaba coronavirus diagnosis AI
description: A new AI-powered diagnosis system promises to detect new coronavirus cases with an accuracy rate of up to 96% via computerized tomography scans. The new diagnostic tool was first introduced in a hospital in Zhengzhou, Henan province and now the system will also be adopted in more than 100 hospitals in the provinces of Hubei, Guangdong and Anhui, said Alibaba.

title: Pwc's stress monitoring wearables
description: PwC UK has rolled out an AI wristband to its staff that monitors the wearer’s pulse, sleep and exercise patterns, and how they recover from heightened anxiety levels. Its aim is to understand how they are coping with stress during the lockdown.

title: Cadline’s iTWOsafe contact tracing system
description: Cadline’s iTWOsafe contact tracing system is a phone app which connects to a Bluetooth Low Energy device (BLE) worn as a wristband or attached to a uniform, that together track physical distance to other devices nearby. The system is great for employers; if an employee catches coronavirus traceable contact history can identify which other workers need to quarantine without closing the entire business, and it can also pinpoint where contacts take place, so a company can put in place extra measures, like a one way system.

title: Soter Analytics' wearable contact tracing device
description: Soter used Bluetooth to develop a social distancing upgrade to its SoterSpine wearable device, a 2cm by 2cm and 20g black box. Clipped to a shirt or lanyard it alerts workers if they come within two metres of one another, to lessen the risk of contact. It also gathers data so at the end of the day it syncs detail of who has been in contact with who and for how long.

title: NHS announces partnership with Huma to remotely monitor patients with COVID-19 symptoms
description: Huma helping NHSX to create 'Virtual Wards' to monitor self-isolating patients with COVID-19 symptoms.

title: Spanish Spanish Think Tank tracking COVID using Bank Transaction DataCovid-Tracking with Bank Transaction Data
description: The Center for Economic Policy Research exploits high-frequency/high-resolution transaction data from BBVA, the second-largest bank in Spain, to analyse the dynamics of expenditure in Spain during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. This dataset provides the opportunity to study the impact of the ongoing crisis in Spain--and the policies put in place to control it--on a daily basis. Transaction metadata also allows the studying of variations in the expenditures across geography, sectors, and mode of sale (e.g. online/offline). Transaction data captures many salient patterns in how an economy reacts to shocks in real time, which makes its potential value to policy makers and researchers high.
organizations: The Center for Economic Policy Research

title: COVID Symptom Study app
description: Large-scale symptom study by health science company ZOE and endorsed by the Welsh Government, NHS Wales, the Scottish Government and NHS Scotland. According to the project's website: "Participants have downloaded the app and are using it to regularly report on their health, making it the largest public science project of its kind anywhere in the world. App data is being analysed in collaboration with King's College London researchers.
organizations: NHS Wales,  the Scottish Government and NHS Scotland., Kings College, Welsh Government, Zoe

title: Beat Covid Gibraltar: Gibraltar’s contact tracing app
description: The Government, and I in particular, have zero interest in where you have been, whom you have been with and what you are doing," said Chief Minister Fabian Picardo.
organizations: Contact Tracing Bureau, Gibraltar Health Authority

title: Hand-washing detector at Spanish hospital
description: One Barcelona, Spain, hospital is meanwhile testing a system that would require staff to wash their hands before unlocking doors to let them into patient rooms or intensive care units.

title: Digital health passports considered for football fans
description: Avi Lasarow, Prenetics’ chief executive for the EMEA region, told Reuters that digital health passports also offered the potential for eventually allowing matches to be played in front of spectators again. The digital health passport is a web-based platform that shows a person’s COVID-19 testing status and history by scanning a QR code to secure access to any venues where safety is a concern.

title: Teetamman: Saudi quarantine app
description: The Ministry of Health launched the app Teetamman, which collects health data for those who are in quarantine or self-isolation. People can use it to assess their health condition, speak to medical staff, and seek their advice. Recently, the app was made compulsory for those who are returning from abroad, and individuals are forced to wear a bracelet paired with the phone app via Bluetooth. The user must wear the bracelet at all times during the quarantine period, not change any of its settings, and keep the phone on for 24/7 hrs and within 10 meters proximity.
enforcement_details: Any attempt to remove or damage the bracelet or change any of these settings is punishable by up to two years in prison, a fine of 53,268 USD (200,000 Saudi Riyal), or both.

title: Soapy hand-washing tracker
description: Handwashing stations that can be combined with facial recognition so employers can assess which employees are washing their hands correctly. Not created for the pandemic but the company has cut prices in response.

title: Western Australia purchases anklets with GPS tracking for monitoring people in quarantine
description: People who don't comply with quarantine orders are to be given an electronic ankle bracelet to wear
enforcement_details: Mandatory for people who had not “complied” with their quarantine order

title: PwC creating facial recognition tool
description: Big Four accountant PwC is preparing to roll out a facial recognition tool that will allow clients to track employees’ absences from their computer screens while they work from home.

title: Siemens and Salesforce developing products to help companies get back to work.
description: Solutions will include "boarding passes’ for building and elevator entry, and a safe occupancy management system which will send warnings when room occupancy limits are reached.Employee check-in and contact tracing will also be available. Data will be collected many times per second using Siemens sensors, and delivered to workers and managers via apps.

title: Covid-19 Platform: A database designed to track people in quarantine, carry out contact tracing and identify large gatherings
method: Big data, CCTV, Satellite data, Telecom data
description: According to Human Rights Watch, the platform amalgamates calls to the 171 emergency phone number, data from the Salud EC symptom checker app, information provided by cellphone service providers, satellite tracking and smartphones geolocation carried out by the ministry of telecommunications, as well as video surveillance via a nationwide camera system. Apparently, an algorithm is also used to detect the movement of cellphones between mobile phone antennas.

title: Japan’s Fujitsu Ltd has developed an AI to monitor handwashing
description: Fujitsu’s AI can recognize complex hand movements and checks if people are completing a six-step hand washing procedure that asks people to clean their palms, wash their thumbs, between fingers and around their wrists, and scrub their fingernails. The AI can’t identify people from their hands but could be coupled with identity recognition technology so companies could keep track of employees’ washing habits, a company representative told Reuters. The AI was under development before the coronavirus outbreak for Japanese companies introducing stricter hygiene regulations, according to Fujitsu. It is based on crime surveillance technology.

title: Moscow's "Социальный мониторинг" or "Social Monitoring" quarantine app
description: To make sure quarantined patients in Moscow stay home, the app sends push notifications with selfie requests at random times. However, users say they have been wrongly fined for leaving the apartment when they were taken to the hospital or others received penalties when their phones could not install the app because of technical limitations.
enforcement_details: Mandatory for patients under quarantine; subject to fines

title: Nigeria's COVID-19 Triage Tool
description: Users are asked questions about their symptoms which is then used by the NCDC to monitor the spread of the disease and also in support of contract tracing (users share their location with the app).
organizations: Nigerian Centre for Disease Control (endorsed after creation), Wellvis

title: COVID-19 Provincia de Santa Fe app
description: According to Google Play store, the app enables health monitoring and also allows users to report neighbours and local shops that are breaking restrictions.

title: Alipay health code app
description: Health code system, much like WeChat but embedded in Alipay. Regional varieties exist.

title: Honduras plans contact tracing app
description: According to an interview with Access Now's Verónica Arroyo: "In the case of Honduras, the contact tracing tool will work with a digital id (certification to circulate) that will be registered each time the citizen goes to a store. If it happens that a person who visited that store gets a positive COVID19 result, the system will notify the people that went to that store.

title: Perú En Tus Manos: symptom checker app
Plan Jalisco Covid-19 contact tracing app
description: The app is a contact-tracing tool that allows authorities to track the spread of the virus. It also provides users with information on symptoms and virus prevention.

title: Paraguay false "Emergency Census"
description: It isn’t a government initiative. It isn’t endorsed by the Ministry of Health. The government warned it isn’t an official site and  asked the population not to register in false portals.
link: Interview with TEDIC, Paraguay based digital rights organisation

title: Drones used in Paraguay but details unclear
link: Interview with TEDIC and Access Now

title: Ñangareko: Paraguay food platform for vulnerable people
description: Data collection project - In exchange for food assistance and money transfers, eligible citizens must access the website and answer a lot of census-style questions. The government intends to reach over 330,000 people with the platform.

title: Ford US rolls out symptom checker questionnaire for employeed
description: Ford's Covid-19 daily screening site asks employees about international travel and if they have tested positive for the virus

title: COCOA: Japan releases contact tracing app called COVID-19 Contact-Confirming Application
method: App, Bluetooth, Google Apple Exposure Notification (GAEN), Smartphone
description: The Japanese government hired a team of Microsoft developers to create the app, which uses core technology jointly developed by Apple and Google. Tokyo-based company Code for Japan was initially hired to lead the project, but conditions imposed by Apple and Google — namely that the software could only be managed by public health agencies — meant the project was eventually transferred to the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare while another developer was found.

title: Care19 Alert: exposure notification app available in Wyoming and North Dakota
method: App, Bluetooth, Google Apple Exposure Notification (GAEN), Smartphone
description: Care19 exposure was launched after Google and Apple introduced their API

title: DELETE Care19 in South Dakota
description: Care19 tracks users’ location

title: Belgium adopts mobile tracking to limit beach crowds
description: “Belgium has set up a new system to track mobile phones in order to limit crowding of seaside resorts and beaches”. It’s unclear whether mobile phones on the beach are detected via telecom data or another way.

title: DiagnoseMe: Burkina Faso self-assessment app
description: According to the developer: “The app uses a questionnaire about a person's symptoms and measure respiratory rate through phone microphones, to estimate whether they are likely to have Covid. Contact tracers or special health agents are able to call people who are suspected to be infected for investigate and organise a meet for laboratory test.”

title: BSafe: Botswana contact tracing app
description: QR code contact tracing app that works in two ways: businesses scan visitors’ QR code to check they are not infected and visitors scan businesses QR code to create a "digital register
organizations: Brastorne Enterprises, Presidential Covid-19 Task force

title: Redbird: Ghana’s symptom checker website
description: Symptom checker app developed by a Redbird, a medical start-up. Requires a phone number to work.

title: Libya symptom checker app
description: Telehealth platform Speetar developed self assessment app in partnership with the Libyan Ministery of Health (MoH) and the National Center for Disease Control (NCDC).

title: Lagos university developing self-assessment app
description: Lagos State University develops COVID-19 self-test app for Nigerians

title: Nigerian National Petroleum Corp contact tracing app
Nigerian state of Ogun launches self assessment app
description: Ogun State Government launched a self-assessment app with a questionnaire to be answered. "Responses are monitored on a dashboard at the  Ministry of Health which will flag high risk individuals as red who are promptly followed up by the State Epidemiologist", according to the government account on Twitter.

title: Nigeria CDC self assessment app
Nigerian state of Kogi launches self-assessment app
description: State Government of Kogi launches self-assessment app/website in which citizens answer questionnaire

title: Keep.out.Covid: Suite of tools including temperature checks and symptom checker
description: Keep.Out.Covid is a simple and easy to use app that consists of a suite of tools that help with temperature checks, symptom diagnosis, information collection and most importantly, the flagging of employees that are at risk of having COVID-19, according to the company.

title: Corona Fighter: self-assessment chatbot for corporations
description: According to the developer: "An employee app, which is uniquely deployed as a chatbot across most popular chat applications (including WhatsApp, FB Messenger, etc. - full list on website) allows employees and visitors to screen themselves for COVID-19 symptoms remotely before they come into work. Those provisionally cleared for entry are sent a secure QR code valid for 24 hours. Those with symptoms are directed towards help including booking video calls with an assigned medical practice, and getting directions unto the latest NICD guidelines and company policies. Should the employee later be cleared by a COVID test, they can upload their clearance directly from the chatbot.”

title: Covid-19 Connect: South Africa’s WhatsApp chat bot
description: The WhatsApp bot developed by Praekelt uses Turn.io’s machine learning technology to deliver automated responses for free with information on coronavirus including travel advice, latest numbers, symptoms and to dismiss myths and misconceptions.

title: CommonPass: global immunity passport
description: CommonPass establishes partnerships with testing facilities. In order to travel, a person must get tested at one of the partner facilities. Then, the lab results will be sent straight to the app. The CommonPass platform assesses whether the individual’s lab test results or vaccination records (1) come from a trusted source, and (2) satisfy the health screening requirements of the country they want to enter. CommonPass delivers a simple yes/no answer as to whether the individual meets the current entry criteria, but the underlying health information stays in the individual’s control.

title: Desviralize: Brazil monitoring website using blockchain
description: On a website, users answer a questionnaire on possible symptoms. Using blockchain technology, the information feeds a collective and open database.

title: Canada's self-assessment app
description: A tool to help you track your symptoms, receive the latest updates on COVID-19, and access trusted resources

title: Quebec halts plans for own contact tracing app after public consultation; adopts national app
description: After carrying out a public consultation to measure attitudes to exposure notification app between July and August, Québec halted plans for a regional app and moved to adopt the app being used nationally.

title: BC COVID-19 App: British Columbia self-assessment app
description: Information and symptom checker app for British Columbia province in western Canada
organizations: British Columbia Ministry of Health, Thrive Health

title: Guyana symptom checker website
description: The government of Guyana launched a self assessment/symptom screening website

title: Nevis Health: self-assessment app
description: According to app description: users can create an Account and submit their information to help the NIA Ministry of Health (MOH) assess the health condition of the population and plan its response to health related situations and outbreaks.

Using the Protect Scotland app, along with sticking to current public health measures, will help us to stay safe when we meet up, socialise, work or travel. This postcode checker will show you the current restrictions in your local area.

According to Mint: " Consumers will have to download the app and the authorities will update records of infected patients on the backend. Using this data, the app maps GPS locations of phones and tells users whether they came within 5-10 metres of a COVID-positive patient."

The company that makes the platform told media three unspecified police departments were planning to use the platform. The company also created Delhi Police’s Automated Facial Recognition Software.

title: Intugine's Location Intelligence Platform used for quarantine enforcement in Indian states
description: The states of Maharashtra, Arunachal Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Goa and Madhya Pradesh are using software that enables them to monitor large numbers of quarantined people through a single dashboard, to ensure people are following social distancing norms and adhering to quarantine orders. System doesn't require any app download

title: nCOVID-19 Nagaland quarantine app used in India’s northern Nagaland state
description: The app says it shows authorities where quarantined individuals have been. It also includes a self-assessment function.
organizations: Kishore Reddy of Sita Corp, Mon district administration

title: AiiHealth: Contact tracing app and USSD code
description: Users who share data gain access to a health-mapping system and authorities can send alerts if they have come into contact with someone who has tested positive. People who don't have smartphones can use USSD codes, aided by telecom operators. The function is available within the Aiisma data marketplace.

title: Corona Watch Karnataka information and infection map app
purpose: Public information and awareness, Mobility tracking
description: Shows locations of COVID Patients and their movement history of 14 days. General Public can use this to identify their movements in that area. Also indicates the nearest health center
organizations: Government of Karnataka, Center for e-Governance

title: Kerala police to use drones to enforce coronavirus rules
description: Kerala police to use drones to surveil adherence to physical distancing and use of masks. According to the Hindu, the police would patrol public places and residential neighbourhoods to detect violators of the epidemic control Ordinance and slap fines or effect arrests, if necessary.

title: In Delhi, commuters must show that they are symptom-free with a mobile health app before boarding the subway, flights and to enter some offices.
description: More details needed.

title: My Slots: Contact tracing app for businesses
description: My Slots’ is a smartphone application that allows visitors to shops or offices scan a QR codes to help them identify all the places they went incase they test positive for coronavirus. Unclear if the app is in-use.

title: New Dehli proposes using drones for social distance enforcement
description: AP reports: “Police will enforce physical distancing and prevent the mixing of the population inside more than 200 containment zones in the capital, where large clusters of cases have been confirmed. Surveillance cameras or drone monitoring will also be used.”

title: Italian city of Como has installed dozens of facial recognition cameras to monitor crowds for social distancing violations.
Quarantine bracelets for travellers arriving in Jordan
description: According to the Jordan Times, People arriving in Jordan must isolate for 14 days at designated hotels then they must self-isolate for an additional 14 days at home where they must use the quarantine bracelet. The bracelet connects to a person’s phone via Bluetooth with GPS enabled, a source told Roya. It is unclear if the bracelet is linked to one of Jordan’s apps.

title: Bus shelters in Seoul equipped with thermal imaging cameras
description: Seoul's Seongdong-gu district rolled out 10 bus shelters powered by solar energy and equipped with ultraviolet sterilizers and thermal imaging cameras that check temperatures. Ten more such shelters are planned.

title: The Cayman Islands uses wearables called Bio Buttons to enforce quarantine for incoming travellers
description: The wearable is designed to catch early Covid symptoms among incoming travellers, after the country reopens its borders. Incoming travellers will be asked to wear a BioButton for 14 days and self-isolate at a residence of their choice for five days before taking another test. If negative, they will continue their bio-monitoring for a further nine days without needing to self-isolate.

title: Lithuania launches Korona STOP
method: App, Bluetooth, Google Apple Exposure Notification (GAEN), Smartphone
description: Using the mobile application "Korona Stop LT" we can stop the spread of the virus much faster. Join the international coronavirus alert system by installing the app on your smartphone.
organizations: Dizaino kryptis, The National Public Health Center

title: Lithuania quarantine app
description: The app was announced as a “national” app in April. But since, the State Data Protection Inspectorate ordered the app be suspended in May but it is still available on the Google Play Store and the government said they never purchased the app. Apparently, there is also a pay dispute ongoing.

title: CovidPass: Blockchain immunity passport
description: Created by a Morrocan entrepreneur, CovidPass uses blockchain technology to store encrypted data from individual blood tests, allowing users to prove that they have tested negative for COVID-19.

title: QR-code wristbands for everyone entering the eastern state of Sarawak
Itoju: Nigerian Coronavirus website enabling people to report “suspicious activity”
description: The website includes an infection map, information about the virus and a reporting system where users can report “suspicious activity”.

title: CoronaMelder: Dutch Contact tracing app launched
method: App, Bluetooth, Google Apple Exposure Notification (GAEN), Smartphone
description:
You can pass coronavirus on to other people even if you do not have symptoms. The earlier you find out that you have (or could have) coronavirus, the easier it is to make sure you do not pass it on to other people. The CoronaMelder app helps you do this.

If you receive a notification from the app, you should stay at home for 10 days after the date of contact with an infected person. This way, you can avoid infecting your parents or grandparents, for example. And you can avoid spreading the virus in busy places, such as a market or sports event.
organizations: Welfare and Sport, Apple, Google, Ministry of Health

title: Peru SMS survey
description: “After 104 days of lockdown, a measure that has severely mashed the economy, the government launched its national Covid-19 survey in June, describing it as important to “track the behaviour of the corona”,  and asked the citizens to help by letting the state track their location using the GPS that comes in the smart phones.”

title: Philippine police plan to monitor social media for quarantine breakers
description: “Police could use public postings on social media as leads,” Guillermo Eleazar, head of a task force charged with enforcing quarantine protocols, told Reuters.

title: TraceFast: Philippines’ contact tracing app using “Gapple” system
method: App, Bluetooth, Google Apple Exposure Notification (GAEN), Smartphone
description: The Manila Bulletin “reached out to Multisys to clarify if TraceFast is just a rebranding of their original contact tracing system. According to a company representative, TraceFast is a different app from StaySafe.ph.

title: Two Filipino companies relaunch the SafePass app
description: SafePass, a Filipino-made digital COVID-19 incident mitigation and management solution, is now available to all organizations – be it small or big businesses and establishments. It offers two types of free plans: SafePass Base, which features basic contact-tracing and digital health questionnaires; and SafePass Express, which comes with employee management features, and is free for government agencies and for establishments accredited by the Department of Tourism.

title: Vaccify: Pakistani immunity passport app
description: Plans for the app function around the idea that people can go to an accredited hospital, get tested, and receive their verification digitally on the app. The approach is blockchain-based and Vaccify’s certificates will be decentralised and tamper-proof. Because of this, the certificate will be trusted both nationally and internationally.

title: COVID-19 Gov PK: Pakistani self-assessment app and map
description: Self-assessment app that then locates infected people on a map
organizations: Telecom with National Information Technology Board, Ministry of IT

title: Tawakkalna: Saudi permit app
description: According to MIT: “Tawakkalna app pairs with Tabaud, the contact tracing app, and allows citizens to request "movement permits" for mobility around the city.”
organizations: National Information Center, Ministry of Health

title: Tabaud: Saudi contact tracing app
method: App, Bluetooth, Google Apple Exposure Notification (GAEN), Smartphone
description:
Based on the keenness of the Government of Saudi Arabia, may God bless it, to maintain the health and safety of its citizens and residents from the risk of Coronavirus spreading; The Saudi Data and Artificial Intelligence Authority (SDAIA) has launched "Tabaud" application to support government efforts in tackling Coronavirus.

According to the health system and its implementing regulations (in Saudi Arabia), the Ministry of Health has approved health standards on which the "Tabaud" application has been developed. The characteristics and functions of this application will be subject to any additional instructions issued in implementation of the regulations and provisions of Saudi Arabia, in order to achieve the health and safety goals envisaged in developing the application by involving individuals to control Coronavirus outbreak, and limit its spread, in order to gradually reduce the restrictions imposed on social life and other activities.

The "Tabaud" application is a way to notify those who are in contact with people infected with coronavirus, so individuals can download and use "Tabaud" application to achieve the health and safety purposes of developing the application,

The application sends camouflaged identifiers data to the smart phones using the same application, which were registered during the contact with people infected with Coronavirus, accompanied by the data of the infected people devices, in accordance with the policies that the two international companies (Google and Apple) maintained, while maintaining the full privacy of users.

The application enables the user to receive direct and proactive notifications in case of any registered infected person has been detected, for the purpose of requesting direct health support from the Ministry of Health (in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia).
organizations: Ministry of Health, Saudi Data and Artificial Intelligence Authority

title: Travellers arriving in Singapore from certain countries can quarantine at home if they wear an electronic monitoring device
description: Arrivals from certain countries can quarantine at home if they wear a wearable device for 14 days that ensures they don’t go out.

title: Singapore police trial social distance detecting drones
description: The pilot free drones are programmed to track anomalies such as gatherings and stream footage to the police. According to the Israeli company that made the drones, this is the first time automated commercial drones have been approved to fly over a major metropolis.
organizations: Police, Airobotics, Home Team Science & Technology Agency

title: Singapore's Universal Studios deploys facial recognition for entry
description: “Facial recognition provides contactless verification of tickets and ticket holders, enabling our customers to enjoy our park experience in a more efficient and seamless manner,” Resorts World Sentosa (the company which owns the sprawling area of tourist attractions, hotels and restaurants in which the park sits) said in an emailed statement to Reuters.

title: In Singapore, touch-free kiosks with thermal sensors at busy bus stops and train stations allow passengers to check their temperature before boarding.
description: A green light indicates they are free from fever, while an orange light shows a high temperature.
organizations: Community and Youth Singapore, Hope Technik, Land Transport Authority Singapore, Ministry of Culture, Singapore Defence Science and Technology Agency

title: In Singapore, the SGWorkPass dictates which migrant workers are allowed to leave their dormitories and resume work.
description: According to local media, a worker who has received approval to resume work will see a green AccessCode on their SGWorkPass app once they meet the following conditions: both the worker and the dorm he lives in must be Covid-19-free, and his employer must have received approval to resume work as well. To download SGWorkPass, users must also have registered on the TraceTogether contact tracing app.

title: Slovenia developing an app to track children placed in quarantine
description: Unclear whether the app would publish the individual children in quarantine or just aggregated data from schools.

title: DDC Care: the app monitors the user’s health and asks for travel history as well as people they have been in contact with
description: App requires the user (those who have been diagnosed by the hospital or the disease screening point in Thailand, including the airport, that they are at risk of being infected) to submit a self-assessment report directly to DDC during the 14-day detention period. They must also report travel history and backlog of people whom they've been in contact

title: Taiwanese software FaceMe Health can detect if a person is wearing a mask
description: The FaceMe Health tool could be used to detect whether people are wearing masks and take their temperature before giving them a green light to enter a store. “Right now we’re having lots of inquiries from retail stores, restaurants, and the hospitality space because those businesses are badly hurt and they need to reopen and find solutions,” a company representative told Forbes.

title: Alabama State University uses smart thermal temperature cameras
description: These devices screen for COVID-19 symptoms, reads biomarkers such as temperature, heart rate and respiratory rate by quickly scanning the image of a person’s face.

title: Volunteers in Hawaii tracking tourists breaking quarantine
description: According to AP, as of June 20th, a Facebook group called “Hawaii Quarantine Kapu Breakers: had helped police find and arrest around 35 people on the islands. The report details how one tourist was tracked for 14 days.

title: Public safety app Citizen adds an exposure notification function
method: App, Bluetooth, Google Apple Exposure Notification (GAEN), Smartphone
description: The company is incentivising downloads by also offering covid tests to anyone who has been exposed for $140. In September, L.A. County Public Health Director Barbara Ferrer encouraged citizens to download the app.

title: GuideSafe™ Event Passport
description: According to the GuideSafe website: “GuideSafe™ Event Passport is used to facilitate access to meetings, events, or facilities having ten or more people. Event attendees will complete Healthcheck, a COVID-19 assessment tool, prior to entering their event. Event passport is issued based on a proprietary risk algorithm factoring your daily healthcheck assigned risk level. After you have completed Guidesafe™ Healthcheck, press the “Passport” button to get your passport. Your passport is valid for the day. Each user is assigned a unique passport number indicating their status for the upcoming event which will show a “Clear” screen or “Not Clear” screen.”
organizations: The University of Alabama at Birmingham

title: SenseGiz technologies company launches wearables to enforce social distancing and also help with contact tracing
description: The wearables buzz if people get too close to one another, the system also alerts bosses to “serial violators”. There are inactivity alerts in case someone takes off the wearable. Geo-fence function can also be implemented to monitor people placed under quarantine.

title: Hawaii Safe Travels system
description: Incoming travellers to Hawaii must create an account with a system called SafeTravels, entering their personal information in order to get a QR code that will help them pass through the airport. 24-hours before their flight, they must complete a travel health questionnaire about any symptoms. Once they are in Hawaii, they must undergo 14day quarantine, during which they will receive daily check-ins.
organizations: Google, Office of Enterprise Technology Services, SpringML

organizations: Nevada Division of Public and Behavioral Health

method: App, Bluetooth, Google Apple Exposure Notification (GAEN), Smartphone

description: According to Apple Insider, California's Department of Public Health has been hesitant to adopt the Apple framework but “UCSD will function as a proof-of-concept that could open up the app to the rest of the state.”

Carnegie Mellon’s Exposure Notification app
description: According to Georgia Tech, a university deploying the app: “NOVID leverages a combination of ultrasound and Bluetooth technology to note other devices that are within 6 feet, and only if they remain that close for 15 minutes or more. By briefly using the device’s microphone and measuring the time sound takes to travel, ultrasound can accurately measure the distance between devices. The benefit of this combined method is avoiding false positives that would be generated from Bluetooth alone, such as contacts that may be on the other side of a wall – nearby, but not creating a risk of exposure.”

title: New York’s Rochester Institute of Technology requires Daily Health Screen
description: Students, teachers and staff at New York’s Rochester Institute of Technology must complete the RIT Daily Health Screen every day, seven days a week, whether or not they are coming to campus.

title: Perry Township Schools, in Indianapolis, is planning to use an AI system to enforce safe social distancing and detect when students are less than six feet apart.;
Michigan’s Oakland University launches The BioButton for contact tracing and health monitoring.
description: Originally launched as a mandatory measures, the university administration u-turned to make the tech voluntary after backlash led by students.

title: Private Las Vegas school adopts thermal AI as students return to class
description: The Remark AI Thermal Kit, from Remark’s bio-safety business, is an all-inclusive solution that allows for fast, touch-free scanning of multiple students (up to 120 people per minute) as they enter through established access points on a school campus. The private school in Las Vegas is the first in the US to adopt the Remark AI Thermal Kits.

description: Not all riders will be asked to verify they are wearing a mask, only if a driver previously reported they are not wearing a mask or they haven’t used the app for a while.

description: Online platform where students and faculty can answer a daily questionnaire on symptoms of COVID and receive instructions on what to do next.

description: The app was created by a teacher in partnership with their students at the William M. Davies Jr. Career & Technical High School in Lincoln

method: App, Bluetooth, Google Apple Exposure Notification (GAEN), Smartphone

title: Corona Fighter: Access Management App
description: According to the developer: "A stand-alone web app which allows clients to secure their building access points. This app scans employee and visitor QR codes issued by the bot to ensure they are cleared for entry, the access manager then inputs the user's temperature and confirms they are wearing a mask before the app grants or denies entry.”

title: Corona Fighter: Management Dashboard
description: According to the developer: "The management dashboard is a standalone web-app that allows managers to assess the risk in their organisation at a glance. It also alerts Health Managers to incidents and has full case management functionality, including document management, quarantine timelines, medical history etc. Health managers can see symptom progression over time at both an individual and organisational level to properly respond to incidents.”

title: CoronaFighter: Symptom checker
description: Citizens can access the website to fill a questionnaire to conduct a self-assessment of symptoms. In the same platform, they can track symptoms daily, see latest guidelines and follow the more updated statistics

title: Immunity passport app for truck drivers in East Africa
description: Once drivers are tested, a digital health certificate will be generated and valid for 14 days so it can be checked at designated stops along the driver's routes. According to the New Times, “Designated stop locations will be geofenced in the App and Regional Electronic Cargo Tracking System platform. Any prolonged stop outside these locations will issue an alert or warning to the authorities and truck owners of the violation.”

title: The Africa Communication and Information Platform for Health and Economic Action
description: According to reports: "Launching the service, the UN's Economic Commission for Africa said it provided two-way communication between citizens and health authorities, and had the potential to reach 80 per cent of Africa’s mobile users at no cost to the individual… One of the platform’s primary use cases is to collect health information from individuals, allowing authorities to identify local outbreaks and virus hotspots. It also provides advice and support to those affected.”
organizations: Airtel Africa, MTN, Orange, United Nations, Vodacom

description: Dubai police are experimenting with thermal helmet cameras for officers to check passers-by’s temperatures.

title: Angola's COVID app: symptom checker, information and infringement reports
description: The app contains up-to-date information on the outbreak in Angola, a chat service, self-assessment instructions, an interactive map with COVID cases, maps indicating nearest healthcare units, a function that allows one to denounce Emergency State

title: Brazilian researchers work on AI tool to detect COVID by voice
description:
Researchers at the University of São Paulo are developing an AI-system that will be able to recognize if a patient is going through respiratory problems only by voice. If well-succeeded, the tool will help in the triage of COVID-19 patients in health services. 

To teach the AI, researchers have collected voices of over 5,000 patients admitted to the university hospital but are also receiving input from volunteers, who can contribute through a form.

title: European Commission launches interoperability gateway service linking national COVID apps
description: After a successful pilot phase, the European Commission launched an interoperability gateway service linking national contact tracing apps across the EU. In the first phase, the gateway links Germany's Corona-Warn-App, Ireland's COVID tracker, and Italy's immuni, which together account for 2/3 of all app downloads in the EU

title: Burkina Faso's Ministry of Health launches app Corona Detect to combat COVID-19
description: Corona Detect is an application open to the general public which allows each user to carry out a self-diagnosis in order to obtain rapid follow-up and support when needed. Available for Android and Java phones in Burkina Faso's four national languages
organizations: Health Ministry, Terre des Hommes (TDH), UNICEF, USAID, World Health Organisation

title: Burkina Faso's Ministry of Health launches app Corona Contact to inform people of possible contagion
purpose: Public information and awareness, Contact tracing, Self-diagnosis
description: "An application dedicated to people who have had contact with a confirmed or probable case of Covid-19. It will provide daily information on the evolution of symptoms during the follow-up period."
organizations: Health Ministry, Terre des Hommes (TDH), UNICEF, USAID, World Health Organisation

title: Burkina Faso's launches app to allow health services to screen through alerts inputted by users
description: "An application that will allow medical teams at each health level to analyze the alerts that users have sent through Corona-Detect"
organizations: Health Ministry, Terre des Hommes (TDH), UNICEF, USAID, World Health Organisation

title: TrateCOV: Brazil's chloroquine-recommending app
description: In early January, Brazil's Health Ministry adopted the new app 'TrateCOV' to help doctors collect symptoms and patient signals. But soon groups of doctors and tech experts realized the app would automatically prescribe the use of chloroquine, regardless of what input it received. On Jan. 21st, the app was taken down by the ministry.

title: StayHome: Bhutan quarantine monitoring app
description: App to be used by citizens in quarantine to monitor the user’s movement and to allow regular submission of their health status. Quarantined citizens are encouraged to download the app.

title: Belize Travel Health App for travellers to submit requested information and contact-tracing functionality
description: Government-developed app for travellers to submit travel & health information in order to travel to Belize. Application also has a geo-tracking function to assist health officials in contact-tracing.
organizations: Belize Department of Immigration and Nationality and Services, Belize Tourism Board, Ministry of Health, Statistical Institute of Belize

title: Chilean municipality Las Condes launches temperature-screening helmet to be used by officials
description: The mayor of Las Condes, Joaquin Lavin, announced temperature-screening helmets to be worn by municipality workers inside buses and crowded places. The helmet allows the person wearing it to rapidly assess the temperature of people in the crowd at one glance.

title: Colombian government reaches agreement with Samsung to pre-download CoronApp in phones
description: The Colombian government reached an agreement with Samsung to have the CoronApp pre-installed in all new Samsung phones and Samsung publicly endorsed the app

title: Police in Colombia use temperature-screening drones
description: Colombia's police use drones to assess lockdown compliance and temperature-screening. According to Reuters, if a drone detects someone with a potential fever it sends the location to a medical team that seeks out the person to determine if they have coronavirus symptoms.

title: Cuba launches "Virtual Investigator" app with self-assessment survey
description: Cuba launched a university-developed app with a survey to be filled in by users for self-assessment purposes. According to Granma, the app complements an active-research process of the public health system
organizations: Cuban Ministry of Communications, Cuban Ministry of Public Health, University of Informatics Sciences (UCI)

title: Costa Rican Edus App to record symptoms and conditions and monitoring confirmed and suspected high-risk cases
description: The pre-existing government health app Edus received an update for Coronavirus, allowing users to record symptoms and conditions and self-assess contagion risk
organizations: Caja Costarricense de Seguro Social (Costa Rican Social Security Fund (CCSS)

title: Baidu launches online Covid-19 self-diagnosis tool
description: Search giant Baidu has released a tool allowing people to determine risk levels for infection by Covid-19. The tool uses the Chinese government’s diagnosis and treatment plan for the virus as well as records from millions of online medical consultations to assess whether a user is at low, moderate, or high risk of having caught the bug.

title: Macao Health Code on government website
description: A QR three-colour code system has replaced the Health Bureau’s digital health declaration that is required at border checkpoints and for entering public administration premises, casinos and other premises. The new system, officially known as “Macau Health Code”, asks its registrants three things, namely 1) symptoms, 2) COVID-19-patient contact history and 3) travel history. The new code consists of three colours: red, yellow and green.

title: Chinese cities requiring real-name registration for public transport
description: An increasing number of cities around China are requiring commuters to register their identities when using public transport. Commuters in Shanghai will be encouraged to scan a QR code in their subway car after boarding. Passengers will then be prompted to confirm their mobile phone numbers. System was introduced in Shanghai, Shenzhen and Ningbo.

title: CyprusFlightPass interface for incoming passengers
description: Incoming travellers are required to submit personal information and health statements. On successful completion of application, they receive a report including their CyprusFlightPass and all relevant information which will be asked to present prior to boarding and on arrival at immigration.

title: COVID-19MX: Mexico's app for self-assessment and information
description: Government-developed app with self-assessment functions and information on health services and corona-virus response. App also contains location of nearest testing centres and good hygiene practices.

title: Mexican state of Chihuahua launches self-assessment app
