V-Health Passport: British startup launches immunity passport platform
description: The V-Health Passport can be used to perform a series of actions, including user authentication, and COVID-19 test results, and vaccinations input provided by all the major vaccination manufacturers. The app features its own GDPR-compliant contact tracing capability, which reportedly uses anonymized data according to the concept of ‘self-sovereign identity’.

title: Google starts publishing Coronavirus Mobility Reports (Aggregated Location Tracking)
description: Google is using GPS location data from mobile phones to publish online reports showing changes in the number of visitors to public places such as transport hubs, parks, workplaces, homes, pharmacies, and grocery stores in 131 countries.

title: Amazon's Alexa to help assess possible COVID symptoms
description:
Users in the United States can ask Alexa questions about COVID that will prompt the voice assistant to ask questions about symptoms, travel history and potential exposure to the virus. It then offers advice based on official information by the US Center for Disease Control (CDC)

In February 2021, Alexa received an update which now allows it to help users find the nearest testing centre:

title: Amazon's Alexa to help Canadians assess COVID symptoms
description: Using guidance from the Public Health Agency of Canada, customers in Canada can ask Alexa to check their symptoms of COVID-19 at home. The voice assistant will then ask questions about symptoms and possible exposure. Then, based on information from authorities, she will provide guidance.

title: Amazon's Alexa to help Mexicans assess COVID symptoms
description: Using guidance from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and measures published by Mexican authorities, customers in Mexico can ask Alexa to check their symptoms of COVID-19 at home. Plus, you can ask Alexa about the daily numbers of COVID-19 cases in Mexico, the latest news, and updated local measures.

title: Amazon's Alexa to help Brazilians assess COVID symptoms
description: Using guidance from Brazil's Ministry of Health, customers in Brazil can ask Alexa to check their symptoms of COVID-19 at home. You can also ask for the nearest public hospital and for additional information about COVID-19—including how to protect yourself and your family. Alexa will respond through a new skill developed by the Eldorado Research Institute that uses information from the Albert Einstein Israelite Hospital, a renowned health institution in Brazil.

title: Amazon's Alexa to help Indians assess COVID symptoms
description: Using guidance from the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and Indian Council for Medical Research (ICMR), customers in India can use Alexa to check their symptoms for COVID-19 at home. Ask, "Alexa, what do I do if I think I have coronavirus?" or "Alexa, how do I know if I have coronavirus?" Alexa will ask a series of questions and provide ICMR and Ministry of Health guidance given risk level and symptoms.

title: Amazon's Alexa to help Japanese assess COVID symptoms
description: In Japan, you can also use Alexa to check your risk level at home. Based on your responses, Alexa will provide Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor, and Welfare guidance matching your risk level and symptoms.

title: WHO expands COVID-19 chatbot against misinformation to Facebook messenger
description: After launching the chatbot service to combat COVID-19 misinformation for Whatsapp in March, the WHO expanded the feature to Facebook Messenger, available in 4 languages, English, Spanish, French and Arabic.

title: WHO launches COVID-19 Whatsapp chatbot in 11 languages
description: This messaging service provides the latest global news and information on COVID-19, including details on symptoms and how people can protect themselves and others. It also provides the latest situation reports and numbers in real-time to help government decision-makers protect the health of their populations. Available in 11 languages

title: WHO launches WHO Academy: COVID learning app for healthcare workers
description: This app provides health workers everywhere with an efficient way to access the World Health Organization’s COVID-19 knowledge resources all in one place, including up-to-the-minute guidance, tools, training, self-paced learning, and virtual workshops to support health workers in caring for patients infected by COVID-19 – as well on how they can protect themselves as they do their critical work. Available in six languages

title: Israeli company Synel launches new heat camera
description: Synel MLL PayWay Ltd., a location-based solution for HR management for payroll and time management services, has incorporated a heat camera in its latest app update. The latest addition to its software will make it easier for security officers in public buildings to measure the temperature of people entering offices or gyms

title: Delhi Corona app allows citizens to check availability of hospital beds
description: Delhi government launched an app for information on the availability of hospital beds and ventilators in the city's designated COVID hospitals

title: Delhi government launches Jeevan Seva app to use electric vehicles to transport non-critical COVID patients
description: Delhi government launches app to offer electric vehicles as an ambulance to transfer non-critical cases to health care facilities for free across the city. Users can request the ride, which will be free, through the app

title: Indian Government launches website where citizens can issue e-passes for movement during lockdown
description: Citizens can access the website to apply for e-pass that allows movement between states during lockdown; central govt. website redirects to states' websites

title: Indore adapts existent app with features for home-grounded asymptomatic patients
description: Indore adapted an existing city app (Indore 311) to include features for COVID-19 patients. Features include daily questionnaires to be answered, pulse oximeter function, and GPS to monitor if patient stays at home

title: Madhya Pradesh's Sarthak self-assessment app
description: The app is designed to help users to identify whether they are at risk of COVID-19 and provides people with important information. But as reported by The Quint in May, the app was temporarily taken down after a French hacker found vulnerabilities, ie: he could assess a dashboard with complete names, addresses of users. The issue was fixed and it is still up and running.

title: New Dehli used drones for social distance enforcement
description: The Delhi Police used drones for effective surveillance of containment zones to combat the threat of coronavirus, a police official said. They hired drones from 'Aerodyne India'

title: Khmer Quarantine App: COVID app for quarantined people
description: The Khmer Quarantine App is a mobile app developed to help those who are suspected of having COVID-19 to monitor their own health during quarantine and to facilitate quarantine management for authorities. The app provides self-monitoring, health history, and emergency contact information to get treatment as soon as possible.

title: SK Telecom deploys AI system to assist with COVID-19 quarantine
description: The South Korean telco's AI, dubbed Nugu, will make voice calls twice a day to those in mandatory 14-day quarantine. The quarantine is currently imposed on those who come into contact with confirmed patients or those coming from abroad. The Nugu AI will ask those in quarantine whether they have a fever, cough, or throat pains, among other questions that are currently asked by human staff, as well as check their temperature.

title: South Korean government releases mask sales data to encourage developers to create apps
description: The South Korean government made mask sales data available as an open API to encourage developers to create apps that notify people about the inventory statuses of pharmacies nationwide after a nation-wide shortage. According to the Korea Herald, 5 days after the govt's data release, there were more than 15 apps available.

title: Morrocan researchers announce intelligent COVID mask to be used with app
description: Morrocan researchers have announced the launch of the initial phase of a “smart mask for automatic remote detection” of Covid-19 (MIDAD), accompanied by a “tracking” application (Trackorona), which offers a method of predicting and diagnosing the disease.

title: Malaysia: QR-code wristbands for travellers arriving to Sarawak state
description: The authorities in Sarawak require everyone entering the eastern state to strap on a QR-coded wristband. Upon scanning the QR code, the wearers will have to enter a set of information into a website.They will have to report their locations at 8am and 8pm daily. This allows the health authorities to monitor their whereabouts during the 14-day quarantine period and perform "random checks" on them based on the information sent from the device.
enforcement_details: Mandatory for travellers entering the state

title: Pakistan's CoronaCheck: self-assessment app developed by university
description: The app uses an interactive chatbot, driven by artificial intelligence, which allows users to understand their symptoms, recognise whether they may have contracted COVID-19 and seek help in a timely manner. It also aims to identify potential coronavirus carriers, limit their risk of transmission and to list the national helplines available.

title: Pakistani government opens Whatsapp line to collect reports on violations of COVID-19 measures
description: The National Command and Operation Center has opened a Whatsapp account to collect reports from citizens on violations of COVID-19 measures, such as non wearing of mask, non adherence to Social distancing, over crowding at public places etc

title: UN Africa Commission sets up platform to transmit COVID-19 information  between authorities and +600 mi mobile users.
description: According to reports: "Launching the service, the UN's Economic Commission for Africa said it provided two-way communication between citizens and health authorities, and had the potential to reach 80 percent of Africa’s mobile users at no cost to the individual… One of the platform’s primary use cases is to collect health information from individuals, allowing authorities to identify local outbreaks and virus hotspots. It also provides advice and support to those affected.”
organizations: Airtel Africa, MTN, Orange, United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA), Vodacom

title: Singapore Police deploys UAVs to patrol migrant dormitories
description: Singaporean police deployed UAVs to complement police patrolling in migrant dormitories

title: Singaporean government to give arriving travellers eletronic monitoring device for quarantine
description: Arrivals from certain countries can quarantine at home if they wear a wearable device for 14 days that ensures they don’t go out. if they violate quarantine, they are subject to punishment, which includes fines

title: Sydekick for THAIFIGHT COVID-19
description: App developed to track and monitor people coming from countries heavily hit by the coronavirus that are required to self-quarantine. Anyone required to self-quarantine must download the app to identify themselves before leaving their quarantine centre. The system will help government staff monitor daily behaviour of at-risk groups, determining whether they detain themselves at home in line with the specified period.
organizations: Articulus, Thailand Digital Economy and Society Ministry

title: CoronaCheck: self-assessment mobile app launched for Tajikistan
description: "App allows users to evaluate symptoms with an in-home screening tool and understand the next steps to looking after themselves".
organizations: Aga Khan University and Hospital, Digital Health Resource Centre of the Aga Khan Development Network (AKDN)

title: Turkey arrests citizens for provocative posts about the virus on social media
description: Turkish authorities arrested over 400 people for "provocative" posts on social media about the coronavirus outbreak. Over 2,000 accounts were identified as involved

title: eMask platform: Taiwanese collaborative platform to inform population about stocks of face masks
description: Taiwanese government made data on masks inventories available and hacking community created apps and platforms to inform population, avoiding a shortage of facemasks

title: Uganda launches "Call the Clinic" COVID app
description: MOH CTC is a telemedicine healthcare platform. The App provides real time data visualization and analysis using digital maps enabling remote patient diagnosis. A user will be able to register using their phone number and brief bio data and will be able to access immediate access to health agents via voice call.

title: Real estate solutions firm develops hospitality solution VQueue
description: VQueue+, vQueue+ Thermal, and vQueue is a solutions package to help the retail, commercial, healthcare, large venue, and hospitality sectors save time, improve guests' experience, and ensure adherence to local ordinances in place to protect visitors and employees. Some features include measuring occupation level, creates reservations and virtual queue; a totem that can read guests' temperatures and a virtual communication tool between businesses and guests.

title: Covid-19 tracker in Zimbabwe: users upload Google Maps history
description: OpenParlyZW created an open-source information aggregating public information on the virus. As one of the features, citizens can upload their Google map histories and it'll show where they've come across cases of COVID or places where someone with the coronavirus has been.

title: Amazon buys thermal cameras from Chinese blacklisted company Dahua
description: Reuters reports that Amazon bought 1,500 thermal cameras from Chinese blacklisted company Dahua in deal worth at least US$10 mi; at least 500 were to be used in the US

title: Amazon uses Time off Task software (TOT) during pandemic
description: Amazon's surveillance technique ToT is being used during pandemic, even though it was in place since at least April 2019. The tracking system is able to track a worker's physical movements as they take breaks or move between tasks.

title: Tyson Foods using thermal cameras to assess employees' temperatures
description: Instead of hand-held thermometers, large employers like Tyson are using thermal cameras to assess employees' temperature in company facilities

title: Intel Corp using thermal cameras to assess employee's temperatures
description: Instead of hand-held thermometers, large employers like Intel are using thermal cameras to assess employees' temperature in company facilities

title: PwC develops Check-In, an app to track movement within factory floors/company facilities
description: PwC developed Check-In, a "automatic contact tracing hardware ecosystem" that uses a smartphone’s Bluetooth signal to track workers’ movements without capturing real-time geolocation information. It works with a mobile app, a wearable device or a beacon. The system can be bought by other companies

title: Triax re-purposes existing software to allow customers to enforce social-distancing
description: Triax, a company which develops devices helping factory floors and other workplaces monitor workers' movements in hazardous or restricted areas, has re-purposed its technology to allow customers to enforce social distancing

title: US-based Hubstaff's remote work tracking software being used by companies to monitor employees
description: Hubstaff's software includes features such as time-tracking, GPS tracking, online timesheets, reporting, productivity monitoring and geofencing. According to TRF, CEO David Nevogt reported a three-fold increase in requests for trials since March

title: Enaible uses AI to allow companies to rank employees according to productivity
description: Enaible, a Boston-based firm, is developing machine-learning software to measure how quickly employees complete different tasks and suggest ways to speed them up.

title: TSheets Time Tracker app enables GPS permission to monitor employees
description: The TSheets time clock app substitutes paper timesheets and also tracks time and GPS locations. Reports show it has been used in combination with other softwares

title: InterGuard can be installed without consent on employee's computers for remote work monitoring
description: Washington Post reports that InterGuard can be installed in a hidden way on workers’ computers and creates a minute-by-minute timeline of every app and website they view,  ranking workers by their “productivity score.”

title: South Korea to launch blockchain digital vaccine passport
description: South Korea announced it will launch this month a mobile app to allow international travelers to show digital proof of vaccination. According to the prime-minister, the app employs blockchain technology to prevent falsification

title: UK to test vaccine passport in comedy club, nightclub and soccer matches
description: The government said a COVID-status certification system was being developed that would show whether a person had had a vaccine, a recent negative test or natural immunity from a positive test taken in the last six months. The system will be tested in the coming weeks in a comedy club, a nightclub and FA Cup matches at Wembley.

title: Bahrain launches digital vaccine passport
description:
Bahrain’s ‘BeAware’ app displays a green shield alongside an official certificate detailing the person’s name, date of birth, nationality and which vaccine was received.

Users must have received two doses of a vaccine, separated by 21 days, and then wait for two weeks for antibodies to develop, the statement said.

title: Denmark developing digital vaccine passport
description: Denmark is developing a digital “vaccine passport” for people who have received a COVID-19 vaccine. According to the health ministry, the passport may be accessed through the Danish public health website (unclear if there will be an app)

title: Denmark calls for bids for vaccine passport
description:
Denmark has called for bids to build a new corona passport app that can show holders' vaccination and antibody status, and PCR and rapid test results, with the winner having just over two months to deliver.

The agency has already held meetings with four companies to discuss the project, the US IT giant IBM, the Danish IT companies Netcompany and Trifork, and the Norwegian IT firm Visma.

title: Denmark to start requiring immunity proof for hairdressers and restaurants
description:
From April 6th, the Corona Pass will be used by, among others, the hairdresser, masseur and outdoor amusement parks, and from 21 April to have a cup of coffee at the sidewalk café. From 6 May, it gives access to get indoors at restaurants and theaters.

The App 'MinSundhed' will be used as the corona pass until the end of May, when a more user-friendly app will be launched.
enforcement_details:
According to The Local: The agreement includes a sundown clause on the corona passports, news wire Ritzau reports.

That means that they can no longer be required (apart from in relation to travel and tourism) when everyone in Denmark has been offered a vaccine, which is likely to be by August this year according to the current vaccination calendar.

title: Israel launches Green Pass immunity proof
description:
The Green Pass is an entry permit to places or facilities for recovered coronavirus patients and vaccinated people. The permit can be presented on the smartphone or printed. 

Citizens can apply for the permit on Ministry of Health site, or the Traffic Light (Ramzor) App (Google Play, App Store), or the Ministry of Health Hotline at *5400.

title: EU announces plan to launch unified bloc-wide immunity passport
description:
The European Union launched an effort to create a joint vaccination passport for its more than 440 million citizens and residents. 

The passes, which could be ready by June, are expected to be digital or paper documents for travelers to prove that they have been vaccinated, that they recovered from the virus, or recently tested negative for it.

title: New York State to test Excelsior immunity pass
description:
Governor Andrew M. Cuomo today announced a pilot program to test the Excelsior Pass during events at Madison Square Garden and Barclays Center. 

The Excelsior Pass will use proven, secure technology to confirm an individual's vaccination or a recent negative COVID-19 test through a confidential data transfer to help fast-track the reopening of theaters, stadiums and other businesses

title: China launches vaccination passport within WeChat
description: China has launched a health certificate programme for Chinese citizens travelling internationally. The digital certificate, which shows a user’s vaccination status and virus test results, is available for Chinese citizens via a programme on Chinese social media platform WeChat

title: Bahia state (BR) mandates thermal scanning in terminals, airports and on road checkpoints
description: In Brazil, the state government of Bahia announced on the 16th of March temperature screenings of all passengers arriving in airports, bus terminals and at checkpoints on federal highways effective March 17th.

title: Brunei installs thermal screenings at all seven entry points
description: Brunei installs thermal screenings at all seven entry points starting from February 1st. UPDATE: The temperature screening was limited to Brunei international airport and was now extended to all seven entry points

title: Transport Canada is mandating temperature screening for air passengers
description: Transport Canada is mandating temperature screening for air passengers through a phased approach beginning June 12, 2020, first for those travelling to Canada, then for those travelling from Canada, and finally for those travelling within Canada.

title: Mandatory use of thermal scanners at schools in Henan, China
description:
The department of education of Henan, China issued policies regarding to reopening the schools on Mar 9. 
Schools must strictly control the number of entrances and exits. Usually only one gate is allowed to open per campus, subject to change (open more during peak hours to avoid gatherings).
All faculty, staff and students who enter the campus should show health certificates and conduct temperature tests. Schools must be equipped with necessary temperature detection equipment (set up thermal temperature scanners at entrance if possible).

title: Fiji checks all international air passengers with handheld temperature scanners prior to entering the country
description: March 18th, Fiji checks all international air passengers with handheld temperature scanners prior to entering the country, and their travel history and health status will be screened by border agents.

title: Georgia (nation) mandates thermal scanning at different stations throughout the country
description: On March 31 Prime Minister’s spokesperson (Georgia) has announced that the Inter-Agency Coordination Council on Coronavirus has decided to install temperature screening stations in Telavi and Akhaltsikhe, in addition to seven other major cities (Tbilisi, Kutaisi, Batumi, Poti, Rustavi, Zugdidi and Gori),

title: Hong Kong mandates temperature checks at restaurants
description:
Hong Kong is imposing restrictions on the operations of catering business from March 28 at 6pm. 

The number of customers at catering premises must not exceed 50% of the normal seating capacity; Tables must be at least 1.5 metres from each other; No more than 4 persons may be seated together at one table; A person must wear a mask at any time, except when the person is consuming food or drink; Body temperature screening must be conducted before the person is allowed to enter; hand sanitisers must be provided

title: Iraq mandates the use of thermal scanners at airports
description:
The Iraqi authorities on July 16,  announced that airports will re-open as of Thursday, July 23 for commercial flights. The airport administration has made wearing masks, hand gloves mandatory for all workers and passengers. It has also taken steps to ensure that workers and passengers maintain social distancing according to the recommendations of the World Health Organization. Thermal temperature screening is in place at airport entrances and for arriving passengers.  Individuals exhibiting symptoms of COVID-19 and/or those not wearing face coverings may be denied boarding or entry to the airport.
Passengers departing Iraq may be required to provide negative COVID-19 test results prior to departure depending on the country of destination. Those departing to locations with COVID-19 test requirements may be required to provide negative results within the specified time frame of the destination. individuals traveling to Iraq are required to carry out a COVID-19 test 48 hours prior to the flight and should be prepared to present results at passport control.

title: People arriving to Rome Fiumicino Airport arriving from Wuhan need to undergo a thermal scan
Kuwait subjects incoming air passengers to a temperature screening
description: Passengers arriving in Kuwait must obtain an approved PCR health certificate confirming negative COVID-19 test results.  They will also be required to register with the Shlonik application before boarding their aircraft for Kuwait and must sign a commitment pledge to comply with quarantine measures once in Kuwait. Body temperature scans will be taken for all passengers before boarding their aircraft and upon arrival in Kuwait. A random PCR test will be conducted on passengers upon arrival in Kuwait.

title: Lebanon airport scans all incoming air passengers
description: Staff at Lebanon's international airport in Beirut will carry out temperature screenings on all travelers (arrivals and departures) beginning March 4, 2020.

title: Macau screens passengers for fever
description: From January 4, Macau conducted temperature screening to drivers and travellers who enter Macao via land-based checkpoints

title: Malaysia screens temperature of incoming passengers
description:
March 16 — Members of the public who have dealings with Immigration offices nationwide will be subjected to body temperature screenings in a bid to stem the Covid-19 outbreak.

Immigration Department director-general Datuk Khairul Dzaimee Daud said the screenings will be conducted at the main lobby of the offices as the other entrances will be closed.

“For now, the operating hours for Immigration counters will remain the same, but we will limit the number of people allowed in,” he said.

title: Myanmar enforces health checks and body temperature screenings at land borders
description: Myanmar enforces health checks and body temperature screenings at land borders for residents, starting March 19.

title: Mandalay (Myanmar) implements health scans in form of temperature scans of people visiting the Mahamuni pagoda and at major markets across the city
description: Mandalay (Myanmar) implements health scans in form of temperature scans of people visiting the Mahamuni pagoda and at major markets across the city

title: Singapore mandates several locations for thermal screening at the borders
description:
As of January 03, Singapore implements a "temperature screening at Changi airport for inbound travellers arriving on flights from Wuhan, and suspected cases will be referred to hospitals for further assessment".
The Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) has implemented temperature screening at all sea checkpoints, including ferry and cruise terminals, PSA Terminals and Jurong Port, for inbound travellers from 24 January 2020, 1200 hours onwards
The Singapore government has announced that temperature screening will be implemented at Woodlands and Tuas Checkpoints from 24 January 2020, 12 noon onwards.

title: Singapore requests educational institutes to screen pupils' temperatures a few times a day
description:
On 28 May the Early Childhood Development Agency Singapore released an open letter to parents of preschool children in line with the reopening of preschools and nurseries in June 2020. They released the Covid-safe ABCs. 

Health checks and temperature screening will be conducted for all children and staff on entry and several times a day. The health checks will look for general signs of children feeling unwell, beyond fever, cough, runny nose, sore throat, and shortness of breath. Any child or staff who is unwell will not be allowed into the preschool. Those who become unwell during the course of the day will be immediately isolated and asked to leave. Parents are advised to seek medical attention promptly if their child is unwell and avoid clinic hopping. Children should stay at home to rest and return to the preschool only when fully recovered. Children/Staff with adult household members who have fever and/or flu-like symptoms such as cough, runny nose, sore throat, shortness of breath are encouraged to stay home, if possible

title: In Russia, all incoming passengers from international flights undergo temperature screening
description: In Russia, all incoming passengers from international flights undergo temperature screening (those with elevated temperatures are examined, tested, and sent for quarantine or self-isolation) from March 2, 2020.

title: Ivanovo region(Russia) enforces daily temperature screening of citizens and mandatory isolation of citizens with high body temperature
description: Starting March 18, 2020, Ivanovo region(Russia) enforces daily temperature screening of citizens and mandatory isolation of citizens with high body temperature

title: Saudi Arabia implements temperature screenings in airports for inbound flights from China
description: The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia began, on January 23rd, to implement temperature screenings in Saudi airports for inbound flights from China amid the coronavirus.

title: The government of Slovakia is starting with temperature screening of passengers for all passengers arriving in Slovakia by air
description: On 28 February 2020, the government of Slovakia is starting with temperature screening of passengers for all passengers arriving in Slovakia by air.

title: Zimbabwe introduces mandatory temperature screening tests
description: It has been announced that travellers arriving in Zimbabwean airports will be subject to certain procedures to reduce the risk of covid-19!spread. The civil aviation officer had this to say about these measures, “In ensuring the safety of passengers and staff, we have introduced new health measures such as mandatory temperature screening and sanitisation before entering the terminal building. Passengers arriving in Zimbabwe must produce a negative PCR result conducted within 48 hours prior to travel. Those showing symptoms of Covid-19 will be tested at the airport as sufficient testing equipment is in place,”
